intro: Ricinocarpus brevibracteatus, commonly known as the narrow-bracted ricinocarp, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that enclose the seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
